raw: * A model that contains all meta data about columns, such as width, renderer,
* visibility and order.
* @see qx.ui.table.ITableModel

@description.name: @description
@description.body: A model that contains all meta data about columns, such as width, renderer, visibility and order.

raw: * Fired when the width of a column has changed. The data property of the event is
* a map having the following attributes:
* <ul>

*
  • col: The model index of the column the width of which has changed.

*
  • newWidth: The new width of the column in pixels.

*
  • oldWidth: The old width of the column in pixels.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired when the width of a column has changed. The data property of the event is a map having the following attributes:

  • col: The model index of the column the width of which has changed.
  • newWidth: The new width of the column in pixels.
  • oldWidth: The old width of the column in pixels.

raw: * Fired when the visibility of a column has changed. This event is equal to
* "visibilityChanged", but is fired right before.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the visibility of a column has changed. This event is equal to "visibilityChanged", but is fired right before.

raw: * Fired when the visibility of a column has changed. The data property of the
* event is a map having the following attributes:
* <ul>

*
  • col: The model index of the column the visibility of which has changed.

*
  • visible: Whether the column is now visible.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired when the visibility of a column has changed. The data property of the event is a map having the following attributes:

  • col: The model index of the column the visibility of which has changed.
  • visible: Whether the column is now visible.

raw: * Fired when the column order has changed. The data property of the
* event is a map having the following attributes:
* <ul>

*
  • col: The model index of the column that was moved.

*
  • fromOverXPos: The old overall x position of the column.

*
  • toOverXPos: The new overall x position of the column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired when the column order has changed. The data property of the event is a map having the following attributes:

  • col: The model index of the column that was moved.
  • fromOverXPos: The old overall x position of the column.
  • toOverXPos: The new overall x position of the column.

raw: * Fired when the cell renderer of a column has changed.
* The data property of the event is a map having the following attributes:
* <ul>

*
  • col: The model index of the column that was moved.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired when the cell renderer of a column has changed. The data property of the event is a map having the following attributes:

  • col: The model index of the column that was moved.

raw: * @type {Integer} the default width of a column in pixels.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Integer} the default width of a column in pixels.

raw: * @type {qx.ui.table.headerrenderer.Default} the default header cell renderer.
* @type {qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Default} the default data cell renderer.
* @type {qx.ui.table.celleditor.TextField} the default editor factory.
* Initializes the column model.
* @param colCount {Integer}
*   The number of columns the model should have.
* @param table {qx.ui.table.Table}
*   The table to which this column model is attached.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Initializes the column model.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
colCount {Integer}
   The number of columns the model should have.
@param.description: The number of columns the model should have.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
table {qx.ui.table.Table}
   The table to which this column model is attached.
@param.description: The table to which this column model is attached.

raw: * Return the array of visible columns
* @return {Array} List of all visible columns

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the array of visible columns

raw: * Sets the width of a column.
* @param col {Integer}
*   The model index of the column.
* @param width {Integer}
*   The new width the column should get in pixels.
* @param isPointerAction {Boolean}
* true if the column width is being changed as a result of a
*   pointer drag in the header; false or undefined otherwise.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the width of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
col {Integer}
   The model index of the column.
@param.description: The model index of the column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
width {Integer}
   The new width the column should get in pixels.
@param.description: The new width the column should get in pixels.

@param.name: @param
@param.description: true if the column width is being changed as a result of a pointer drag in the header; false or undefined otherwise.

raw: * Returns the width of a column.
* @param col {Integer} the model index of the column.
* @return {Integer} the width of the column in pixels.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the width of a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the width of the column in pixels.
@return.description: the width of the column in pixels.

raw: * Sets the header renderer of a column. Use setHeaderCellRenderers
* instead of this method if you want to set the header renderer of many
* columns.
* @param col {Integer} the model index of the column.
* @param renderer {qx.ui.table.IHeaderRenderer} the new header renderer the column
*      should get.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the header renderer of a column. Use setHeaderCellRenderers instead of this method if you want to set the header renderer of many columns.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column.
@param.description: the model index of the column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
renderer {qx.ui.table.IHeaderRenderer} the new header renderer the column
      should get.
@param.description:
the new header renderer the column
      should get.

raw: * Sets the header renderer of one or more columns. Use this method, in
* favor of setHeaderCellRenderer, if you want to set the header renderer
* of many columns. This method fires the "headerCellRendererChanged"
* event only once, after setting all renderers, whereas
* setHeaderCellRenderer fires it for each changed renderer which can be
* slow with many columns.
* @param renderers {Map}
*   Map, where the keys are column numbers and values are the renderers,
*   implementing qx.ui.table.IHeaderRenderer, of the the new header
*   renderers for that column

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the header renderer of one or more columns. Use this method, in favor of setHeaderCellRenderer, if you want to set the header renderer of many columns. This method fires the "headerCellRendererChanged" event only once, after setting all renderers, whereas setHeaderCellRenderer fires it for each changed renderer which can be slow with many columns.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
renderers {Map}
   Map, where the keys are column numbers and values are the renderers,
   implementing qx.ui.table.IHeaderRenderer, of the the new header
   renderers for that column
@param.description:
Map, where the keys are column numbers and values are the renderers,
   implementing qx.ui.table.IHeaderRenderer, of the the new header
   renderers for that column

raw: * Returns the header renderer of a column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the header renderer of a column.

@param.name: @param

@param.description: the model index of the column.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.table.IHeaderRenderer} the header renderer of the column.
@return.description: the header renderer of the column.

raw: * Sets the data renderer of a column.

*   pooling or disposing.

renderer {qx.ui.table.ICellRenderer} the new data renderer
   the column should get.
@param.description:
the new data renderer
   the column should get.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.ui.table.ICellRenderer?null} If an old renderer was set and
   it was not the default renderer, the old renderer is returned for
   pooling or disposing.
@return.description:
If an old renderer was set and
   it was not the default renderer, the old renderer is returned for
   pooling or disposing.

raw: * Returns the map that translates model indexes to x positions.
* The returned map contains for a model index (int) a map having two
* properties: overX (the overall x position of the column, int) and
* visX (the visible x position of the column, int). visX is missing for
* hidden columns.
* @return {Map} the "column to x position" map.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the map that translates model indexes to x positions. The returned map contains for a model index (int) a map having two properties: overX (the overall x position of the column, int) and visX (the visible x position of the column, int). visX is missing for hidden columns.

raw: * Returns the number of visible columns.
* @return {Integer} the number of visible columns.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the number of visible columns.

@param.description: the visible x position of the column.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the model index of the column.
@return.description: the model index of the column.

raw: * Reorders all columns to new overall positions. Will fire one "orderChanged" event
* without data afterwards
* @param newPositions {Integer[]} Array mapping the index of a column in table model to its wanted overall
*                            position on screen (both zero based). If the table models holds
*                            col0, col1, col2 and col3 and you give [1,3,2,0], the new column order
*                            will be col1, col3, col2, col0

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Reorders all columns to new overall positions. Will fire one "orderChanged" event without data afterwards

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
newPositions {Integer[]} Array mapping the index of a column in table model to its wanted overall
                            position on screen (both zero based). If the table models holds
                            col0, col1, col2 and col3 and you give [1,3,2,0], the new column order
                            will be col1, col3, col2, col0
@param.description:
Array mapping the index of a column in table model to its wanted overall
                            position on screen (both zero based). If the table models holds
                            col0, col1, col2 and col3 and you give [1,3,2,0], the new column order
                            will be col1, col3, col2, col0
